intro: Hedyotis confertiflora, commonly known as the clustered dotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Hedyotis confertiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
